snippet: In Silivri, a trial of military officers has prompted protests and has raised concerns about the Islamist-leaning government’s commitment to democracy.
abstract: Dozens of angry secularist protesters have set up tent village outside prison and courthouse in Silivri, Turkey, where hundreds of military officers are on trial for plotting to overthrow Islamic-rooted government; trial and protests raise concerns about Prime Min Recep Tayyip Erdogan's Islamist-leaning government's commitment to democracy.
lead_paragraph: In Silivri, a trial of military officers has prompted protests and has raised concerns about the Islamist-leaning government’s commitment to democracy.

headline.seo: Angry Turkish Secularists Plant Flag at Ergenekon Trial
headline.main: Angry Turkish Secularists Plant Their Flag at Trial
headline.print_headline: Angry Turkish Secularists Plant Their Flag at Trial

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
